task.title: Payload Specialist
task.shortdesc: Payload specialists are persons other than NASA astronauts (including foreign nationals) who have specialized onboard duties; they may be added to shuttle crews if activities that have unique requirements are involved and more than the minimum crew size of five is needed.

step.cmd: Be nominated by NASA, the foreign sponsor, or the designated payload sponsor.
Get the appropriate education and training related to the payload or experiment.
Pass NASA space physical examinations with varying standards depending on classification.
Have a distant visual acuity: 20/100 or better uncorrected, correctable to 20/20 each eye.
